name: colourist
content:
colourist noun [C]
(ARTIST)
Add to word list
Add to word list
an artist who uses colour in a skilful or special way: As a colourist, the painter has no English rivals. This is a fine piece which amply demonstrates her brilliance as a colourist.
someone who adds colour to the drawings for a comic, graphic novel, or animation (= a book or film whose story is told in pictures): His pencilling was obscured by an inker and a colourist. Compare
inker
letterer
penciller
someone who adds colour to a film, especially one made in black and white: As a colourist, he has the ability to add colour and contrast to an old film clip that looks dull and washed-out.
More examplesFewer examplesPeople forget that Picasso was a brilliant draughtsman, composer, and colourist. The sense of depth in this panoply of reds astonishes, testament to Richter's skills as a colourist. Leonardo is regarded as a draughtsman rather than a colourist.He is a renowned comic-book colourist with a fine-art degree and background in photography.

colourist noun [C]
(HAIR)
someone whose job is to change the colour of people's hair: Michelle's colourist opted for a mix of golden brown and natural dark brown. She was a colourist at a London hair salon.
More examplesFewer examplesColoured hair can change in the sun so let your colourist know if you're planning to go away. Colourist Maria added golden lights to add texture and movement to her hair.
